intro: Machaeranthera pulverulenta var. vacans, commonly known as the pale coneflower, is a flowering plant native to the central and southern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple coneflower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and often reddish in color. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators.
